com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class TestResults

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.TestResults

  • public class TestResults
extends Object
    A device for collecting statistics on test errors and displaying the results of the performed tests. An instance of this class is created by a tester class intended to test an individual Quadruple method, before the tester class starts working.
    Then, after performing the test on each individual test case, a set of DataItem instances that contain the source data and the operation result, is passed to methods record(DataItem, DataItem, DataItem) or record(DataItem, DataItem, DataItem, DataItem) (depending on the type of the operation being tested), which register test results.
    When the tests are finished, the summary test results, such as MSE, or mean error, or error counts, can be obtained via respective getters.
    Besides that, a brief report of the form
     Results of testing operand.sqrt();
 on 1203 samples with err threshold 1.470e-39
  MSE        =  3.935e-79
  sqrt(MSE)  =  6.273e-40
  mean error = -6.756e-42
  Max error  =  1.469e-39
-------------------------
  Err %      =      0 (0.00%)
  Hex diff   =      0 (0.00%)
  Src errors =      0
    can be generated and obtained using getReport(String) method.
    The test data and the results may be printed to the console, in case if the instance was created with verbosity parameter that allows such output. The output includes involved data in decimal and hexadecimal forms and an indication of an error (if the error presents), and looks like the following: 
     1200: src:  6.0075035027764865517221905485888473758331471e+318423594 (+7c22_dca1_b2e1_451e 3b43_b0b0_ed29_35f5 e bf0c_723c)
       res:  2.4510209103099236006979103883530902996808415e+159211797 (+b92b_28a1_96a5_be40 fe4a_cb66_8df2_e5f1 e 9f86_391d)
       exp:  2.4510209103099236006979103883530902996813872e+159211797 (+b92b_28a1_96a5_be40 fe4a_cb66_8df2_e5f1 e 9f86_391d)
      39                                          ^^^^^            (-2.226e-40)
    This shows the ordinal number of the data sample (1200), the value of input argument for the operation being tested (Quadruple.sqrt() in this example), marked with "src", the value of the result of the operation ("res"), the value of the the expected result ("exp"), and the difference between the latter two: decimal values differ in the 39-th digit after point, relative error is -2.226e-40.
    In case of error the output for a test sample may look like the following: 
     4080: src:  2.0007498742609427977136284742732350987201479e+641685196 (+9641_7ab8_731c_133a 2c21_e350_af94_2715 e ff0e_1fd0)
       res:  2.000749874260942797714628474273235098720e+641685196
       val:  2.0007498742609427977146284742732350987200000e+641685196 (+9641_7ab8_731c_133a 2fe0_c5d3_ee92_9e6e e ff0e_1fd0)
       exp:  2.0007498742609427977136284742732350987201479e+641685196 (+9641_7ab8_731c_133a 2c21_e350_af94_2715 e ff0e_1fd0)
$$$                                                                                          ^^^ ^^^^ ^^ ^ ^^^^
   21                        ^                  ^^^^            (4.998e-22)
    where the line starting with "$$$" shows the bitwise difference between Quadruple values, and the next line shows that the values are differ in the 21st digit after point and the relative error is 4.998e-22
    Author:
    M.Vokhmentsev

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBitDiffCount()
      Returns the number of cases found where the Quadruple value of the result of an operation was not exactly equal to the Quadruple value of the expected result (i.e. binary differs by at least one bit).
      int getErrCount()
      Returns the number of cases found where the relative error has exceeded a threshold.
      String getReport(String testName)
      Generates and returns a report containing statistics on encountered errors, of the following form: Results of testing op1.add(Quadruple op2) on 3144 samples with err threshold 1.470e-39 MSE = 3.536e-79 sqrt(MSE) = 5.946e-40 mean error = 1.355e-41 Max error = 1.469e-39 ------------------------- Err % = 0 (0.00%) Hex diff = 0 (0.00%) Src errors = 0
      int getSrcErrCount()
      Returns the number of cases found where input parameters for the operation being tested were invalid (could not be parsed as numeric values of the expected source type)
      String getSummaryTestName()
      For summary results, returns the number of particular tests whose results were accumulated to evaluate the summary results contained in this instance
      void record(DataItem srcData, DataItem result, DataItem expected)
      Registers the result of a test of an operation on a single data instance for unary operations.
      void record(DataItem srcData, DataItem result, DataItem resultValue, DataItem expected)
      Registers the result of a test of an operation on a single data instance for binary operations and conversions from Quadruple to other types and vice versa.
      void register(TestResults testResults)
      Adds the results of a particular test performed on a specific operation, accumulated by the passed instance of the TestResults, to the summary results being accumulated by this instance, in order to evaluate summarized results for all tests performed.
      void summarize()
      Performs final calculations that must be done before using the results

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestResults

        public TestResults(double threshold,
                   TesterClasses.Verbosity verbosity)
        Creates a new instance with the given error threshold and verbosity mode. The value passed in as the threshold parameter is used to distinguish an acceptable inaccuracy, inevitable by design, from errors that are indicatives of software bugs. Typically the threshold value for Quadruple is 1.470e-39, which corresponds to half of the least significant bit of the mantissa. The test cases with an error below the threshold don't affect the number of registered errors, yet do affect statistics (mean error, max error and MSE). The value of the verbosity parameter controls whether the test data will be output to the console during testing. The only value that enables the output is Verbosity.TALKATIVE.
        Parameters:
        threshold - defines the threshold to distinguish an acceptable inaccuracy from an error
        verbosity - controls the ability of the created instance to print data to the console. Verbosity.TALKATIVE enables the output.

      • TestResults

        public TestResults(double errThreshold)
        Creates a new instance with the given error threshold and the default verbosity mode, that disables the output to the console. The value passed in as the threshold parameter is used to distinguish an acceptable inaccuracy, inevitable by design, from errors that are indicatives of software bugs. Typically the threshold value for Quadruple is 1.470e-39, which corresponds to half of the least significant bit of the mantissa. The test cases with an error below the threshold don't affect the number of registered errors, yet do affect statistics (mean error, max error and MSE).
        Parameters:
        errThreshold - defines the threshold to distinguish an acceptable inaccuracy from an error

    • Method Detail

      • record

        public void record(DataItem srcData,
                   DataItem result,
                   DataItem expected)
        Registers the result of a test of an operation on a single data instance for unary operations. The DataItem parameters srcData, result, and expected contain data pertaining to the test -- source data value (the input parameter of the tested operation), the actual result of the operation performed on this value, and the expected result of the operation, respectively.
        If the output is enabled, i.e. the instance is created with the Verbosity.TALKATIVE parameter, prints decimal and hexadecimal forms of the three values to the console. Then, in case if the input data is marked as erroneous and the expected parameter does not indicate that the error was foreseen, registers the source error incrementing the srcErrCount field and prints the corresponding message (if the output is enabled).
        If the source data is error-free, compares the actual result of the operation with the expected result. Checks the equality of the Quadruple values of the result and expected parameters, and, if they differ, registers the difference by incrementing the value of the bitDiffCount field. Then compares the BigDecimal values of the result and expected parameters, and, if they differ, calculates the relative error and registers it by modifying meanError, mse, and maxError fields and, if the error exceeds the threshold value that was set when the instance was created, increments the errCount. If the output is enabled, prints corresponding error messages indicating the error magnitude and the positions of characters that differ in the string representations of the result and expected parameters.
        Parameters:
        srcData - the source data that was used for the test (the argument of the operation)
        result - the actual result of the tested operation
        expected - the expected result of the tested operation
        See Also:
        DataItem

      • record

        public void record(DataItem srcData,
                   DataItem result,
                   DataItem resultValue,
                   DataItem expected)
        Registers the result of a test of an operation on a single data instance for binary operations and conversions from Quadruple to other types and vice versa. The DataItem parameters srcData, result, resultValue and expected contain data pertaining to the test:
        • source data value (the input parameter of the tested operation) or the first of the two operands for binary operations,
        • the actual result of the operation performed on this value or the second of the two operands for binary operations,
        • the numeric value of the result,
        • and the numeric value of the expected result of the operation, respectively.
        The srcData and result parameters do not necessarily contain numeric values; in the case of testing conversions, one of them contains a value of the type conversion to or from which is being tested. Their values are not taken into account when evaluating errors, except for the detection of possible errors in the source data.
        If the output is enabled, i.e. the instance is created with the Verbosity.TALKATIVE parameter, prints decimal and hexadecimal forms of the four values to the console. For a parameter that does not contain BigDecimal and Quadruple values, the value of its rawData field is printed using its toString() method.
        Then, in case if the input data is marked as erroneous and the expected parameter does not indicate that the error was foreseen, registers the source error incrementing the srcErrCount field and prints the corresponding message (if the output is enabled).
        If the source data is error-free, compares the value of the actual result of the operation with the expected result. Checks the equality of the Quadruple values of the resultValue and expected parameters, and, if they differ, registers the difference by incrementing the value of the bitDiffCount field. Then compares the BigDecimal values of the resultValue and expected parameters, and, if they differ, calculates the relative error and registers it by modifying meanError, mse, and maxError fields and, if the error exceeds the threshold value that was set when the instance was created, increments the errCount. If the output is enabled, prints corresponding error messages indicating the error magnitude and the positions of characters that differ in the string representations of the result and expected parameters.
        Parameters:
        srcData - the source data that was used for the test or the first argument of the operation
        result - the actual result of the tested operation or the second argument of the operation
        resultValue - the numeric value of the actual result of the tested operation
        expected - the expected result of the tested operation
        See Also:
        DataItem

      • register

        public void register(TestResults testResults)
        Adds the results of a particular test performed on a specific operation, accumulated by the passed instance of the TestResults, to the summary results being accumulated by this instance, in order to evaluate summarized results for all tests performed.
        Parameters:
        testResults - an instance of the TestResults containing the results of testing a specific operation

      • summarize

        public void summarize()
        Performs final calculations that must be done before using the results

      • getErrCount

        public int getErrCount()
        Returns the number of cases found where the relative error has exceeded a threshold.
        Returns:
        the number of errors exceeding the threshold

      • getBitDiffCount

        public int getBitDiffCount()
        Returns the number of cases found where the Quadruple value of the result of an operation was not exactly equal to the Quadruple value of the expected result (i.e. binary differs by at least one bit).
        Returns:
        the number of errors in binary representations of the results

      • getSrcErrCount

        public int getSrcErrCount()
        Returns the number of cases found where input parameters for the operation being tested were invalid (could not be parsed as numeric values of the expected source type)
        Returns:
        the number of errors in the input data

      • getSummaryTestName

        public String getSummaryTestName()
        For summary results, returns the number of particular tests whose results were accumulated to evaluate the summary results contained in this instance
        Returns:
        test name for the summary test. Indicated the number of partial tests taken into account

      • getReport

        public String getReport(String testName)
        Generates and returns a report containing statistics on encountered errors, of the following form:
        
Results of testing op1.add(Quadruple op2)
on 3144 samples with err threshold 1.470e-39
  MSE        =  3.536e-79
  sqrt(MSE)  =  5.946e-40
  mean error =  1.355e-41
  Max error  =  1.469e-39
-------------------------
  Err %      =      0 (0.00%)
  Hex diff   =      0 (0.00%)
  Src errors =      0
        Parameters:
        testName - a name of the tested operation to include to the report (in the example above, it's "op1.add(Quadruple op2)")
        Returns:
        a string consisting of a few lines with a human-readable representation of the test results, as described above
